item.title: Implementing the Belief Mapper in Python, Part 1
item.description: Porting Belief Mapper tool to Python and Flask Belief Mapper is an interactive tool for creating a visual map of a user’s beliefs. The project as it exists now is implemented in Ruby and Rails not actively maintained. PyBeliefMapper is a port of this project to Python and Flask. In this blog post, we will extract the structure of the existing app and look at the steps involved in mapping the belief of a user.

item.title: A TodoMVC Application using Flask-RESTPlus
item.description: An introduction to building REST applications using Flask-RESTPlus, Flask-SQLAlchemy In this blog post, I will go through the steps in building a simple ToDo application using Flask and Flask-RESTPlus. This post is based on the quickstart tutorial except we will be plugging in to PostgreSQL via Flask-SQLAlchemy. Finally, the front end will be done in Elm Design First let’s look briefly at the design of the TodoMVC application.

item.title: The First Blog Post
item.description: Introduction This blog mainly serves as an annotation for my software side projects. A lot of these projects are samples from various books and articles. Some will be full applications. All projects will have complete code, including instructions on installing and running the code. Of course, the source code will be provided on GitHub. Testing the Even theme In the remainder of this post, I will include some rather meaningless snippets to see how the Hugo theme Even lays out various elements.
